info.title: Pandabase
info.description:
Documentation for Pandabase API.

The Pandabase API uses versioning with the `X-Pandabase-Version` header, which allows you to identify the current API version.

In the event of an internal server error, our API includes a `Support ID` in the response, which is the `x-request-id` header provided with every request. This ID helps us track requests, assist with debugging, and provide customer support.

tags.name: Onboarding
tags.description: Onboarding consists of API routes used to onboard new users to our platform. These routes are intended for internal use only and should not be accessed by external applications.

tags.name: Customers
tags.description: The Customer API is intended for private use within our platform. While there are valid use cases for accessing it directly, it is generally not recommended.

tags.name: Tokens
tags.description: Tokens function as keys that allow you to access our API without IP restrictions.

tags.name: Sessions
tags.description: Sessions are not intended for public use, and you should avoid interacting with this resource.

tags.name: Payouts
tags.description: A payout object is created when we process a payment to you or when you initiate a payout to a bank. You can list all payouts, create new payouts, and retrieve payout information based on their ID.

tags.name: Analytics
tags.description: The Analytics API provides raw data on both combined shop analytics and individual metrics, depending on your preferences.

tags.name: Shops
tags.description: Shops are the parent object for products, categories, reviews, payments, refunds, and more. They are the core resource you'll use to sell your products.

tags.name: Products
tags.description: Products are the items you sell in your shop. Each product has attributes like name, description, price, and images. You can organize them into categories, and set stock levels to control availability.

tags.name: Categories
tags.description: Categories help organize products in your shop into groups, making it easier for customers to find related items.

tags.name: Coupons
tags.description: Coupons are promotional codes or vouchers that offer discounts or special deals on products in your shop. They can be applied at checkout to reduce the total price or provide other benefits, helping to attract and retain customers.

tags.name: Orders
tags.description: Orders are records of purchases made by customers. They include details such as the items bought, quantities, prices, and customer information. Orders track the process from purchase to fulfillment and are essential for managing sales and inventory.

tags.name: Payments
tags.description: Payments are transactions that complete the purchase process by transferring funds from the customer to your shop. They include details such as the amount paid, payment method, and transaction status.

tags.name: Reviews
tags.description: Reviews are customer feedback on products or services. They include ratings, comments providing insights into customer satisfaction and product performance.

tags.name: Refunds
tags.description: Refunds allow you to return funds for an order or payment that hasn’t been refunded yet. The money will be returned to the original payment method. Fees charged by us and our payment processor are non-refundable and will be deducted from your shop or account balance.

tags.name: Disputes
tags.description: A dispute occurs when a customer challenges a charge with their card issuer. When this happens, you have the chance to provide evidence to demonstrate that the charge is legit.

tags.name: Carts
tags.description: Carts are temporary collections of items that customers select while shopping. They allow customers to review, modify, and finalize their purchases before proceeding to checkout. Carts track the items, quantities, and total cost until the transaction is completed.

tags.name: Team
tags.description: A team is a group of members who can manage your shop through their vendor dashboard. You can grant them access as needed.

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description: Webhooks are automated messages sent from one application to another when specific events occur. They provide real-time notifications about changes or updates, allowing you to respond immediately to events like new orders, payment updates, or inventory changes.

tags.name: Public
tags.description: Public endpoints are the building blocks for creating your own custom storefront theme with any stack you prefer. We also utilize the Public API behind the scenes there’s no hidden magic.

post.description: This route is used to initiate the onboarding process for a user. Once a request is made, it remains active in the system for one hour. During this time, the user must use the onboarding link sent to their email to begin the onboarding process.

example.message: A user with the same "username" already exists.

post.description: This route uses the token sent via email during the `REGISTER_USER` intent. It requires two parameters: `phone` and `country_code`. The `country_code` must be an ISO2 code that matches the country of the provided phone number, which should include the country code. Once the parameters are validated, an OTP will be sent to the phone number for further verification.

example.message: The phone number you've provided is invalid.

post.description: This route is used to verify the phone number provided during the `REQUEST_PHONE_VERIFICATION` intent. It is a highly sensitive endpoint and is subject to strict rate limits. Upon successful verification of the phone number, it returns a `confirmationToken` in the response.

This route is the final step in the onboarding process. Once the request is successful, it means the user has been successfully created on our platform and can start using their account without any issues.

This route is the final step in the onboarding process. Once the request is successful, it means the user has been successfully created on our platform and can start using their account without any issues.

description.example: Steam is the ultimate destination for playing, discussing, and creating games.
Steam is the ultimate destination for playing, discussing, and creating games.
Steam Gift Cards work just like gift certificates, which can be redeemed on Steam for the purchase of games, software, hardware, and any other item.

type.example: SERIAL, SERVICE, ONE_TIME, PHYSICAL, SUBSCRIPTION, LICENSE

message.description: Only works if type is set to SERVICE

serials.description: Only works if type is set to SERIAL
